      • setVideoSourceIndex

        public java.lang.String setVideoSourceIndex​(int newValue,
                                            boolean setCapIndex)
        Set the selected videoSource index to the specified value and save to device memory. A new videoSource or videoSourceSwitched will be set using this value. New capabilityList and capability will also be set using the new videoSource. This on its own will not start capturing on a new videoSource, if none is currently capturing.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value to be set.
        setCapIndex - If true, will setCapabilityIndex with current value to update capability.
        Returns:
        Null if videoSourceIndex could be set, else an error message might be returned.

      • switchAudioSource

        public java.lang.String switchAudioSource​(boolean ascending)
        Select the next available audioSource on device. This will set the audioSource to be used when capturing starts. If at end of range of audioSources, cycle to start of the other end. If capturing, switching audioSource will not be allowed.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, "next" audioSource is defined in the direction of increasing index, otherwise it is in the opposite direction.
        Returns:
        Null if audioSource could be set, else an error message might be returned.

      • switchVideoSource

        public java.lang.String switchVideoSource​(boolean ascending)
        Stop capturing on current videoSource and capture using the next available videoSource on device. If not currently capturing, this will set the videoSource to be used when capturing starts. If at end of range of videoSources, cycle to start of the other end. If capturing, only the device's cameras can be switched to and fro. If the next videoSource is NDI, then it will be skipped and the next device camera switched to.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, "next" videoSource is defined in the direction of increasing index, otherwise it is in the opposite direction.
        Returns:
        Null if videoSource could be set, else an error message might be returned.

      • switchCapability

        public void switchCapability​(boolean ascending)
        Stop capturing with current capability and capture using the next available capability. If not currently capturing, this will set the capability to be used when capturing starts. If at end of range of capabilities, cycle to start of the other end.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, "next" capability is defined in the direction of increasing index, otherwise it is in the opposite direction.

      • getPubRenderer

        public com.millicast.VideoRenderer getPubRenderer()
        Gets (creates if none exists) a VideoRenderer for the Publisher. By default this renderer will be scaled to SCALE_ASPECT_FIT and set to be mirrored to allow the Publisher to have a natural feel when looking at the local Publisher view. The scaling and mirroring effects are not transmitted to the Subscriber(s).
        Returns:
        VideoRenderer

      • getSubRenderer

        public com.millicast.VideoRenderer getSubRenderer()
        Gets (creates if none exists) a VideoRenderer for the Subscriber. By default this renderer will be scaled to SCALE_ASPECT_FIT. The scaling effect is not transmitted to the Publisher.
        Returns:
        VideoRenderer

      • applyScaling

        public org.webrtc.RendererCommon.ScalingType applyScaling​(boolean forPub)
        Apply again the current RendererCommon.ScalingType of the specified videoRenderer. This could be useful when the videoView's aspect ratio has changed.
        Parameters:
        forPub - If true, will be performed for the Publisher's videoRenderer, else for the Subscriber's videoRenderer.
        Returns:

      • switchScaling

        public org.webrtc.RendererCommon.ScalingType switchScaling​(boolean ascending,
                                                           boolean forPub)
        Set the RendererCommon.ScalingType of the specified videoRenderer to the next type. If at end of range of ScalingType, cycle to start of the other end. The types of scaling in use are: RendererCommon.ScalingType.SCALE_ASPECT_FIT - video frame is scaled to fit the size of the view by maintaining the aspect ratio (black borders may be displayed). RendererCommon.ScalingType.SCALE_ASPECT_FILL - video frame is scaled to fill the size of the view by maintaining the aspect ratio. Some portion of the video frame may be clipped. RendererCommon.ScalingType.SCALE_ASPECT_BALANCED - Compromise between FIT and FILL. Video frame will fill as much as possible of the view while maintaining aspect ratio, under the constraint that at least ~0.5625 of the frame content will be shown.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, "next" ScalingType is defined in the direction of increasing index, otherwise it is in the opposite direction.
        forPub - If true, will be performed for the Publisher's videoRenderer, else for the Subscriber's videoRenderer.
        Returns:

      • getAudioPlaybackList

If currently subscribed, no changes to the current audioPlayback will be made as changes can only be made when there is no subscription on going.

        Returns:

Return a list of size 0 if there is no projected video source. Otherwise, return a list that at least has an empty String ("") as the layer automatically selected by Millicast.

      • getLayerActiveId

      • isNdiOutputEnabled

        public boolean isNdiOutputEnabled​(boolean forAudio)

        Warning: NDI output for AudioTrack is not functional, see warning for enableNdiOutput(boolean, boolean, java.lang.String) for more details.

        Checks if subscribed media (audio or video as specified) has enabled (or requested if not yet capturing) NDI output.
        Parameters:
        forAudio - If true, this is for audio NDI output, otherwise for video NDI output.
        Returns:

      • enableNdiOutput

        public void enableNdiOutput​(boolean enable,
                            boolean forAudio,
                            java.lang.String sourceName)

        Warning: As of SDK 1.1.1 and until documented otherwise in the SDK, enabling and disabling NDI output for AudioTrack is still not functional, i.e. will not have any impact on NDI output when called. To enable audio NDI output for subscribed stream, please use "ndi output" from the list of Audio Playback Devices. Please see setAudioPlaybackIndex(int) and setAudioPlayback().

        Enable/disable subscribed media (audio or video as specified) to be available as NDI output. If media track is not currently available, this will set a flag to enable/disable NDI output for the media when it is available.
        Parameters:
        enable - If true, will enable NDI output, else disable.
        forAudio - If true, this is for audio NDI output, otherwise for video NDI output.
        sourceName - If NDI output enabled, this will be the NDI source name.

      • getVideoSource

        private com.millicast.VideoSource getVideoSource​(boolean getSwitched)

        Parameters:
        getSwitched - If true, return videoSourceSwitched instead.

      • setVideoSource

        private void setVideoSource()
        Set the videoSource at the videoSourceIndex of the current videoSourceList as the active videoSource. The setting of active videoSource is defined as below: If currently capturing: videoSourceSwitched. Else: videoSource.

      • setCapabilityList

        private void setCapabilityList()
        Set list of Capabilities supported by the active videoSource. The active videoSource is selected as the first non-null value (or null if none is available) in the following list: videoSourceSwitched, videoSource.

      • setCapability

        private void setCapability()
        Set the current capability at the capabilityIndex of the current capabilityList, and in the videoSource if available.

      • videoSourceIndexNextNonNdi

        private java.lang.Integer videoSourceIndexNextNonNdi​(boolean ascending,
                                                     int curIndex,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<com.millicast.VideoSource> videoSourceList)
        Gets the index of the next available non-NDI camera. If at end of camera range, cycle to start of the other end. Returns null if none available.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, cycle in the direction of increasing index, otherwise cycle in opposite direction.
        curIndex - The current videoSourceIndex.
        videoSourceList -
        Returns:

      • audioSourceIndexNext

        private java.lang.Integer audioSourceIndexNext​(boolean ascending,
                                               int curIndex,
                                               int size)
        Gets the index of the next available audioSource. If at end of audioSource range, cycle to start of the other end. Returns null if none available.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, cycle in the direction of increasing index, otherwise cycle in opposite direction.
        curIndex - The current audioSourceIndex.
        size -
        Returns:

        private java.lang.Integer videoSourceIndexNext​(boolean ascending,
                                               int curIndex,
                                               int size)
        Gets the index of the next available camera. If at end of camera range, cycle to start of the other end. Returns null if none available.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, cycle in the direction of increasing index, otherwise cycle in opposite direction.
        curIndex - The current videoSourceIndex.
        size -
        Returns:

      • capabilityIndexNext

        private java.lang.Integer capabilityIndexNext​(boolean ascending)
        Gets the index of the next available capability. If at end of capability range, cycle to start of the other end. Returns null if none available.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, cycle in the direction of increasing index, otherwise cycle in opposite direction.
        Returns:

      • codecIndexNext

        private java.lang.Integer codecIndexNext​(boolean ascending,
                                         boolean forAudio)
        Gets the index of the next available codec. If at end of codec range, cycle to start of the other end. Returns null if none available.
        Parameters:
        ascending - If true, cycle in the direction of increasing index, otherwise cycle in opposite direction.
        forAudio - If true, this is for audio codecs, otherwise for video codecs.
        Returns:

      • getErrorSwitchNdi

        private java.lang.String getErrorSwitchNdi​(int newIndex,
                                           com.millicast.VideoSource videoSource,
                                           java.util.ArrayList<com.millicast.VideoSource> videoSourceList)
        Check if it is possible to switch directly to a new videoSource. If current videoSource is capturing, do not allow changing to and from NDI. Only device cameras can be switch directly to each other without stopping capture.
        Parameters:
        newIndex - The index of the new videoSource to switch to.
        videoSource - The current videoSource.
        videoSourceList - The current videoSourceList.
        Returns:
        null if it is possible to switch directly to the new videoSource, else return the error message.

      • startCaptureAudio

        private void startCaptureAudio()
        Using the selected audioSource, capture audio into a pubAudioTrack.

      • stopCaptureAudio

        private void stopCaptureAudio()
        Stop capturing audio, if audio is being captured.

      • removeAudioSource

        private void removeAudioSource()
        Set audioSource to null. If audioSource is currently capturing, stop capture first. New audioSource will be created again based on audioSourceIndex.

      • startCaptureVideo

        private void startCaptureVideo()
        Using the selected videoSource and capability, capture video into a pubVideoTrack.

      • stopCaptureVideo

        private void stopCaptureVideo()
        Stop capturing video, if video is being captured.

      • removeVideoSource

        private void removeVideoSource()
        Set all forms of videoSource to null. If videoSource is currently capturing, stop capture first. New videoSource and capability will be created again based on videoSourceIndex and capabilityIndex.

      • isAudioVideoCaptured

        private boolean isAudioVideoCaptured()
        Check if either audio or video is captured.

      • isAudioCaptured

        private boolean isAudioCaptured()
        Check if audio is captured.

      • isVideoCaptured

        private boolean isVideoCaptured()
        Check if video is captured.

      • setRenderPubVideoTrack

        private void setRenderPubVideoTrack​(com.millicast.VideoTrack pubVideoTrack)

      • renderPubVideo

        private void renderPubVideo()

      • renderSubVideo

        private void renderSubVideo()

      • switchMirror

        private void switchMirror​(boolean toMirror,
                          com.millicast.VideoRenderer renderer,
                          boolean forPub)
        Switch the mirroring of the specified videoRenderer to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        toMirror - If true, renderer will be mirrored, else not.
        renderer - The videoRenderer to be mirrored
        forPub - If true, will be performed for the Publisher's videoRenderer, else for the Subscriber's videoRenderer.

      • setPubMirrored

        private void setPubMirrored​(boolean isMirroredPub)

      • mirrorFrontCamera

        private void mirrorFrontCamera()
        If the active videoSource is a front facing camera, it will be mirrored. If not, it will be set to not mirrored.

      • getPublisher

        private com.millicast.Publisher getPublisher()
        Get the Publisher. If none exist, create one if a Publish View had been set.
        Returns:

      • isPublishing

        private boolean isPublishing()
        Check if we are currently publishing.

      • setCodecs

        private void setCodecs()
        Set the current audio/videoCodec at the audio/videoCodecIndex of the current audio/videoCodecList, and in the publisher as preferred codecs if available and not currently publishing. The current videoCodec will NOT be set if the Publisher is publishing.

      • getSubscriber

        public com.millicast.Subscriber getSubscriber()
        Get the Subscriber. If none exist, create one if a Subscribe View had been set.
        Returns:

      • isSubscribing

        private boolean isSubscribing()
        Check if we are currently subscribing.

      • stopSubscribeAudioVideo

        private void stopSubscribeAudioVideo()
        Set subscribe audio and video states to not subscribing.

      • setAudioPlayback

        private void setAudioPlayback()
        Sets the audioPlayback at the audioPlaybackIndex of the audioPlaybackList. To set the audioPlaybackIndex, use setAudioPlaybackIndex(int).

      • audioPlaybackStart

        private void audioPlaybackStart()
        Start the playback of selected audioPlayback if available.
